title.raw: 《陳涉世家》 House of Chen She

sentences.zh: 陳勝者，陽城人也，字涉。

translations.literal: Chen Sheng was a man from Yangcheng. His courtesy name was She.

sentences.zh: 吳廣者，陽夏人也，字叔。

translations.literal: Wu Guang was a man from Yangxia. His courtesy name was Shu.

sentences.zh: 陳涉少時，嘗與人傭耕，輟耕之壟上，悵恨久之，曰：「茍富貴，無相忘。」

translations.literal: Chen She young time, once with people hired plow, paused plow on ridge, melancholy resent long time, said: 'If rich noble, no mutually forget.'
translations.idiomatic: When Chen She was young, he once hired himself out to plow with others. Pausing on a ridge while plowing, he was filled with melancholy resentment for a long time, saying: 'If we become rich and noble, don't forget each other.'

sentences.zh: 庸者笑而應曰：「若為庸耕，何富貴也？」

translations.literal: Hired ones laugh respond said: 'You as hired plow, what rich noble?'
translations.idiomatic: The hired laborers laughed and replied: 'You who hire out to plow - how will you become rich and noble?'

sentences.zh: 陳涉太息曰：「嗟乎，燕雀安知鴻鵠之志哉！」

translations.literal: Chen She sigh said: 'Alas, sparrows how know great swan ambition!'
translations.idiomatic: Chen She sighed and said: 'Alas! How would sparrows know the ambitions of great swans!'

translations.literal: Chen Sheng was from Yangcheng, with the courtesy name She. Wu Guang was from Yangxia, with the courtesy name Shu. When Chen Sheng was young, he once worked as a hired laborer plowing fields. Stopping on a ridge, he sighed for a long time and said: 'If we become wealthy and noble, don't forget each other.' The other laborers laughed and replied: 'You work as a hired hand plowing fields—how could you become wealthy and noble?' Chen Sheng sighed deeply and said: 'Alas, how could mere sparrows understand the ambitions of a swan?'

sentences.zh: 二世元年七月，發閭左適戍漁陽，九百人屯大澤鄉。

translations.literal: In the seventh month of the first year of the Second Generation, they conscripted commoners to go garrison Yuyang. Nine hundred men were camped at Daze Township.

sentences.zh: 陳勝、吳廣皆次當行，為屯長。

translations.literal: Chen Sheng and Wu Guang were both next in line to go, so they became the camp chiefs.

sentences.zh: 會天大雨，道不通，度已失期。

translations.literal: They encountered great rains, the roads became impassable, and they estimated they had already missed their deadline.

sentences.zh: 失期，法皆斬。

translations.literal: Missing the deadline meant execution by law for all of them.

sentences.zh: 陳勝、吳廣乃謀曰：「今亡亦死，舉大計亦死，等死，死國可乎？」

translations.literal: Chen Sheng, Wu Guang then plotted said: 'Now flee also die, raise great plan also die, equal death, die for country can?'
translations.idiomatic: Chen Sheng and Wu Guang then plotted, saying: 'Now fleeing also means death, raising a great plan also means death. Since death is equal either way, why not die for our country?'

sentences.zh: 陳勝曰：「天下苦秦久矣。

translations.literal: Chen Sheng said: 'World suffers Qin long already.
translations.idiomatic: Chen Sheng said: 'The world has suffered under Qin for a long time.'

sentences.zh: 吾聞二世少子也，不當立，當立者乃公子扶蘇。

translations.literal: I have heard that the Second Generation is the younger son and should not have been established. The one who should have been established is the young lord Fu Su.'

sentences.zh: 扶蘇以數諫故，上使外將兵。

translations.literal: Because Fu Su repeatedly remonstrated, the emperor sent him outside to lead troops.'

sentences.zh: 今或聞無罪，二世殺之。

translations.literal: Now some have heard he was killed without crime by the Second Generation.'

sentences.zh: 百姓多聞其賢，未知其死也。

translations.literal: The common people have heard much of his worthiness, but do not know he is dead.'

sentences.zh: 項燕為楚將，數有功，愛士卒，楚人憐之。

translations.literal: Xiang Yan was a Chu general who repeatedly achieved merit and loved his officers and soldiers. The Chu people pitied him.'

sentences.zh: 或以為死，或以為亡。

translations.literal: Some think he is dead, some think he has fled.'

sentences.zh: 今誠以吾眾詐自稱公子扶蘇、項燕，為天下唱，宜多應者。」

translations.literal: Now truly with our multitude falsely self-name young lord Fu Su, Xiang Yan, become world leader, should many respond.'
translations.idiomatic: Now if we truly use our multitude to falsely proclaim ourselves as the young lord Fu Su and Xiang Yan, and become the leaders of the world, many should respond.'

sentences.zh: 吳廣以為然。

translations.literal: Wu Guang thought this was right.

sentences.zh: 乃行卜。

translations.literal: They then performed divination.

sentences.zh: 卜者知其指意，曰：「足下事皆成，有功。

translations.literal: Diviner knew their intent, said: 'Your excellency matters all succeed, have merit.
translations.idiomatic: The diviner knew their intent and said: 'Your excellency's matters will all succeed and achieve merit.'

sentences.zh: 然足下卜之鬼乎！」

translations.literal: But your excellency divined ghosts!'

sentences.zh: 陳勝、吳廣喜，念鬼，曰：「此教我先威眾耳。」

translations.literal: Chen Sheng, Wu Guang happy, thought ghosts, said: 'This teaches us first awe multitude.'
translations.idiomatic: Chen Sheng and Wu Guang were happy. Thinking about the ghosts, they said: 'This teaches us to first awe the multitude.'

sentences.zh: 乃丹書帛曰「陳勝王」，置人所罾魚腹中。

translations.literal: Then cinnabar wrote silk 'Chen Sheng king', placed in people caught fish belly.
translations.idiomatic: They then wrote in cinnabar on silk 'Chen Sheng king' and placed it in the belly of a fish that people had caught.

sentences.zh: 卒買魚烹食，得魚腹中書，固以怪之矣。

translations.literal: The soldiers bought the fish, cooked and ate it, and found the writing in the fish belly. They indeed marveled at it.

sentences.zh: 又彊令吳廣之次所旁叢祠中，夜篝火，狐鳴呼曰「大楚興，陳勝王」。

translations.literal: Again forced Wu Guang lodging place beside grove shrine, night bonfire, fox cry call 'Great Chu rise, Chen Sheng king'.
translations.idiomatic: They again forced Wu Guang to go to the grove shrine beside his lodging place. At night, they lit bonfires and someone imitated a fox's cry, calling: 'Great Chu rises! Chen Sheng is king!'

sentences.zh: 卒皆夜驚恐。

translations.literal: All the soldiers were startled and terrified at night.

sentences.zh: 旦日，卒中往往語，皆指目陳勝。

translations.literal: The next morning, the soldiers often talked among themselves, all pointing their eyes toward Chen Sheng.

In the first year of the Second Emperor's reign, seventh month, they conscripted the lower classes to serve at the garrison in Yuyang, and 900 men were stationed at Daze Township. Chen Sheng and Wu Guang were both selected to go and made company commanders. Just then there was a great rainstorm, the roads became impassable, and they realized they would miss their deadline. Missing the deadline meant execution by law. Chen Sheng and Wu Guang then conspired, saying: 'Now, fleeing means death, but starting a great enterprise also means death. Since death is certain either way, why not die for our country?' Chen Sheng said: 'The world has suffered under Qin rule for a long time. I have heard that the Second Emperor is the younger son and should not have ascended. The one who should have been emperor is Prince Fusu.' Because Fusu frequently remonstrated, the First Emperor sent him to command troops on the frontier. Now it is rumored that he was innocent, but the Second Emperor killed him. The common people have heard much of his virtue, but do not know he is dead. Xiang Yan was a Chu general who achieved many victories, loved his soldiers, and the Chu people pitied him. Some think he is dead, others think he has fled. Now if we use our forces to falsely claim to be Prince Fusu and Xiang Yan, and start the uprising for all under heaven, many should respond to us.' Wu Guang agreed. So they consulted an oracle. The diviner knew their intentions and said: 'Your affairs will all succeed and you will achieve merit. However, you are consulting the spirits!' Chen Sheng and Wu Guang were delighted, thinking about the spirits, and said: 'This teaches us to first awe the masses.' So they wrote in cinnabar on silk 'Chen Sheng will be king' and placed it in the belly of a fish someone was netting. The soldiers bought the fish and cooked it, finding the writing in the belly, and were already amazed by it. They also forced Wu Guang to go to the shrine in the bushes by their camp, where at night he lit torches and imitated a fox's cry shouting 'Great Chu rises, Chen Sheng will be king.' The soldiers were all frightened that night. The next day, the soldiers whispered among themselves, all pointing at Chen Sheng.

sentences.zh: 吳廣素愛人，士卒多為用者。

translations.literal: Wu Guang usually loved people, and many officers and soldiers were willing to be used by him.

sentences.zh: 將尉醉，廣故數言欲亡，忿恚尉，令辱之，以激怒其眾。

translations.literal: The commandant was drunk. Guang intentionally repeatedly said he wanted to flee, enraging the commandant and causing him to insult Guang, in order to stir up anger among the multitude.

sentences.zh: 尉果笞廣。

translations.literal: The commandant indeed flogged Guang.

sentences.zh: 尉劍挺，廣起，奪而殺尉。

translations.literal: The commandant drew his sword. Guang rose up, seized it, and killed the commandant.

sentences.zh: 陳勝佐之，并殺兩尉。

translations.literal: Chen Sheng assisted him, and together they killed the two commandants.

sentences.zh: 召令徒屬曰：「公等遇雨，皆已失期，失期當斬。

translations.literal: Summoned ordered followers said: 'You gentlemen encountered rain, all already missed deadline, missed deadline should behead.
translations.idiomatic: He summoned and ordered his followers, saying: 'You gentlemen encountered rain and have all already missed your deadline. Missing the deadline means execution.'

sentences.zh: 藉弟令毋斬，而戍死者固十六七。

translations.literal: Even if we rely on the younger brother's orders not to execute you, still ten out of sixteen or seven garrison soldiers die.'

sentences.zh: 且壯士不死即已，死即舉大名耳，王侯將相寧有種乎！」

translations.literal: Moreover brave men not die then stop, die then raise great name, kings marquises generals ministers how have seed!'
translations.idiomatic: Moreover, if brave men do not die, that's the end of it. But if we die, let us raise a great name! Do kings, marquises, generals, and ministers have seeds?'

sentences.zh: 徒屬皆曰：「敬受命。」

translations.literal: Followers all said: 'Respectfully receive command.'
translations.idiomatic: All the followers said: 'We respectfully receive the command.'

sentences.zh: 乃詐稱公子扶蘇、項燕，從民欲也。

translations.literal: Then falsely claimed young lord Fu Su, Xiang Yan, followed people's desire.
translations.idiomatic: They then falsely claimed to be the young lord Fu Su and Xiang Yan, following what the people desired.

sentences.zh: 袒右，稱大楚。

translations.literal: They bared their right arms and called themselves Great Chu.

sentences.zh: 為壇而盟，祭以尉首。

translations.literal: They made an altar and formed an alliance, sacrificing with the commandant's head.

sentences.zh: 陳勝自立為將軍，吳廣為都尉。

translations.literal: Chen Sheng established himself as general, and Wu Guang as deputy commandant.

sentences.zh: 攻大澤鄉，收而攻蘄。

translations.literal: They attacked Daze Township, took it, and then attacked Qi.

sentences.zh: 蘄下，乃令符離人葛嬰將兵徇蘄以東。

translations.literal: Qi fell. They then ordered Ge Ying of Fuli to lead troops and sweep eastward from Qi.

sentences.zh: 攻铚、酂、苦、柘、譙皆下之。

translations.literal: They attacked Zhi, Dang, Ku, Zhe, and Qiao, and took them all.

sentences.zh: 行收兵。

translations.literal: Along the way they gathered troops.

sentences.zh: 比至陳，車六七百乘，騎千餘，卒數萬人。

translations.literal: By the time they arrived at Chen, they had six or seven hundred chariots, over a thousand cavalry, and tens of thousands of foot soldiers.

sentences.zh: 攻陳，陳守令皆不在，獨守丞與戰譙門中。

translations.literal: They attacked Chen. Chen's defending prefect was not present, and only the deputy prefect fought them in the Qiao gate.

sentences.zh: 弗勝，守丞死，乃入據陳。

translations.literal: They were not victorious. The deputy prefect died, and then they entered and occupied Chen.

sentences.zh: 數日，號令召三老、豪傑與皆來會計事。

translations.literal: After several days, by proclamation they summoned the village elders and outstanding men to all come meet and discuss matters.

sentences.zh: 三老、豪傑皆曰：「將軍身被堅執銳，伐無道，誅暴秦，復立楚國之社稷，功宜為王。」

translations.literal: Village elders, outstanding men all said: 'General body wears armor grasps sharp weapons, attacks unrighteous, executes violent Qin, reestablishes Chu state altars soil, merit should become king.'
translations.idiomatic: The village elders and outstanding men all said: 'General, you wear armor and grasp sharp weapons, attack the unrighteous, execute the violent Qin, and reestablish the Chu state's altars and soil. Your merit makes you worthy to be king.'

sentences.zh: 陳涉乃立為王，號為張楚。

translations.literal: Chen She then established himself as king, with the title 'Zhang Chu.'

Wu Guang had always been kind to people, so many soldiers were willing to serve him. The officer was drunk, Wu Guang deliberately spoke several times about wanting to escape, angering the officer, who insulted him, in order to incite the troops. The officer indeed beat Wu Guang. The officer drew his sword, Wu Guang stood up, seized it and killed the officer. Chen Sheng helped him, and they killed both officers. They summoned their followers and said: 'Gentlemen, because of the rain, you have all missed the deadline, and missing the deadline means execution. Even if by luck the order doesn't execute you, going to the frontier means sixteen or seven out of ten will die. Moreover, a heroic man either doesn't die or dies for a great cause. Are kings, marquises, generals, and ministers born with it in their blood?' The followers all said: 'We respectfully accept your command.' So they falsely claimed to be Prince Fusu and Xiang Yan, following the people's wishes. They bared their right shoulders and proclaimed Great Chu. They built an altar and swore an oath, using the officer's head as sacrifice. Chen Sheng made himself general, Wu Guang vice-commander. They attacked Daze Township, captured it, and attacked Qi. Qi fell, so they ordered Ge Ying of Fuli to lead troops and take the areas east of Qi. They attacked Zhi, Zang, Ku, Zhe, and Qiao—all fell. They marched while recruiting troops. By the time they reached Chen, they had six or seven hundred chariots, over a thousand cavalry, and tens of thousands of soldiers. They attacked Chen. The governor and magistrate were not there, only the deputy fought them at Qiao Gate. He could not defeat them, the deputy died, so they entered and occupied Chen. After several days, they issued orders summoning the elders and local leaders to come meet and discuss matters. The elders and leaders all said: 'General, you have worn armor and wielded weapons, attacked the unrighteous, punished the violent Qin, and restored the Chu state's altars. Your merit deserves kingship.' Chen Sheng then established himself as king, calling himself Zhang Chu.

sentences.zh: 當此時，諸郡縣苦秦吏者，皆刑其長吏，殺之以應陳涉。

translations.literal: At this time, the various commanderies and counties that suffered under Qin officials all punished their chief officials and killed them to respond to Chen She.

sentences.zh: 乃以吳叔為假王，監諸將以西擊滎陽。

translations.literal: They then made Wu Shu acting king to oversee the various generals in attacking Xingyang to the west.

sentences.zh: 令陳人武臣、張耳、陳餘徇趙地，令汝陰人鄧宗徇九江郡。

translations.literal: They ordered Wu Chen, Zhang Er, and Chen Yu of Chen to sweep through Zhao lands, and ordered Deng Zong of Ruyin to sweep through Jiujiang commandery.

sentences.zh: 當此時，楚兵數千人為聚者，不可勝數。

translations.literal: At this time, Chu troops formed gatherings of several thousand each, too numerous to count.

At this time, the various commanderies and counties suffering under Qin officials all punished their chief officials and killed them to respond to Chen Sheng. He then made Wu Shu acting king to supervise the generals in attacking Xingyang to the west. He ordered the men from Chen—Wu Chen, Zhang Er, and Chen Yu—to take Zhao territory, and ordered Deng Zong from Ruyin to take Jiujiang commandery. At this time, Chu forces gathered in groups of several thousand, too many to count.

sentences.zh: 葛嬰至東城，立襄彊為楚王。

translations.literal: Ge Ying arrived at Dongcheng and established Xiang Qiang as Chu king.

sentences.zh: 嬰後聞陳王已立，因殺襄彊，還報。

translations.literal: Ying later heard that the Chen king was already established, so he killed Xiang Qiang and returned to report.

sentences.zh: 至陳，陳王誅殺葛嬰。

translations.literal: When he arrived at Chen, the Chen king executed Ge Ying.

sentences.zh: 陳王令魏人周市北徇魏地。

translations.literal: The Chen king ordered Zhou Shi of Wei to sweep north through Wei lands.

sentences.zh: 吳廣圍滎陽。

translations.literal: Wu Guang besieged Xingyang.

sentences.zh: 李由為三川守，守滎陽，吳叔弗能下。

translations.literal: Li You was governor of Sanchuan and defended Xingyang. Wu Shu could not conquer it.

sentences.zh: 陳王徵國之豪傑與計，以上蔡人房君蔡賜為上柱國。

translations.literal: The Chen king summoned the state's outstanding men to discuss plans and made Cai Ci, Room Lord of Shangcai, Superior Pillar State.

Ge Ying reached Dongcheng and established Xiang Qiang as Chu king. Later Ge Ying heard that the Chen king had already been established, so he killed Xiang Qiang and returned to report. When he reached Chen, the Chen king executed Ge Ying. The Chen king ordered Zhou Shi, a Wei man, to go north and take Wei territory. Wu Guang besieged Xingyang. Li You was governor of Sanchuan and defended Xingyang; Wu Shu could not capture it. The Chen king summoned the nation's leaders to consult with them, and made Fang Jun Cai Ci from Shangcai the Grand Marshal.

sentences.zh: 周文，陳之賢人也，嘗為項燕軍視日，事春申君，自言習兵，陳王與之將軍印，西擊秦。

translations.literal: Zhou Wen was a worthy man of Chen. He had once observed the days for Xiang Yan's army and served Chunshen Jun. He claimed to be practiced in military matters, so the Chen king gave him a general's seal to attack Qin to the west.

sentences.zh: 行收兵至關，車千乘，卒數十萬，至戲，軍焉。

translations.literal: Along the way he gathered troops until he reached the pass, with a thousand chariots and tens of thousands of foot soldiers. He arrived at Xi and camped there.

sentences.zh: 秦令少府章邯免酈山徒、人奴產子生，悉發以擊楚大軍，盡敗之。

translations.literal: Qin ordered Zhang Han of the Lesser Treasury to release the convicts from Mount Li and their born children, and send them all to attack the Chu great army. They completely defeated it.

sentences.zh: 周文敗，走出關，止次曹陽二三月。

translations.literal: Zhou Wen was defeated and fled out of the pass. He stopped and camped at Caoyang for two or three months.

sentences.zh: 章邯追敗之，復走次澠池十餘日。

translations.literal: Zhang Han pursued and defeated him. He fled again and camped at Mianchi for over ten days.

sentences.zh: 章邯擊，大破之。

translations.literal: Zhang Han attacked and greatly broke it.

sentences.zh: 周文自剄，軍遂不戰。

translations.literal: Zhou Wen cut his own throat, and the army then ceased fighting.

Zhou Wen, a worthy man from Chen, had once observed the stars for Xiang Yan's army and served Chunshen Jun. He claimed to be skilled in military matters, so the Chen king gave him a general's seal to attack Qin to the west. Marching and recruiting troops, they reached the pass with a thousand chariots and hundreds of thousands of soldiers, arriving at Xi and encamping there. Qin ordered the Chamberlain for the Imperial Revenues Zhang Han to release the convicts from Mount Li and slave children, and send them all to attack the great Chu army, completely defeating them. Zhou Wen was defeated and fled out of the pass, stopping at Caoyang for two or three months. Zhang Han pursued and defeated him again; he fled again and stopped at Mianchi for more than ten days. Zhang Han attacked and greatly defeated him. Zhou Wen committed suicide, and the army then surrendered without fighting.

sentences.zh: 武臣到邯鄲，自立為趙王，陳餘為大將軍，張耳、召騷為左右丞相。

translations.literal: Wu Chen arrived at Handan and established himself as Zhao king. Chen Yu became great general, and Zhang Er and Zhao Sao became left and right chancellors.

sentences.zh: 陳王怒，捕系武臣等家室，欲誅之。

translations.literal: The Chen king was angry. He captured and bound Wu Chen and others' families, intending to execute them.

sentences.zh: 柱國曰：「秦未亡而誅趙王將相家屬，此生一秦也。

translations.literal: Pillar state said: 'Qin not yet perished but execute Zhao king generals chancellors families, this creates one Qin.
translations.idiomatic: The Pillar State said: 'Qin has not yet perished, yet we execute the Zhao king's generals and chancellors' families. This creates another Qin.'

sentences.zh: 不如因而立之。」

translations.literal: Not as good take advantage establish them.'
translations.idiomatic: It would be better to take advantage of this and establish them.'

sentences.zh: 陳王乃遣使者賀趙，而徙系武臣等家屬宮中，而封耳子張敖為成都君，趣趙兵亟入關。

translations.literal: The Chen king then sent envoys to congratulate Zhao. He moved Wu Chen and others' bound families into the palace, and sealed Zhang Er's son Zhang Ao as Lord of Chengdu. He urged the Zhao troops to quickly enter the pass.

sentences.zh: 趙王將相相與謀曰：「王王趙，非楚意也。

translations.literal: Zhao king generals chancellors mutually plotted said: 'King king Zhao, not Chu intention.
translations.idiomatic: The Zhao king's generals and chancellors plotted together, saying: 'To king Zhao is not Chu's intention.'

sentences.zh: 楚已誅秦，必加兵於趙。

translations.literal: Once Chu has executed Qin, it will surely add troops against Zhao.'

sentences.zh: 計莫如毋西兵，使使北徇燕地以自廣也。

translations.literal: The best plan is not to send troops west, but to send envoys north to sweep Yan lands and broaden ourselves.'

sentences.zh: 趙南據大河，北有燕、代，楚雖勝秦，不敢制趙。

translations.literal: Zhao occupies the great river to the south and has Yan and Dai to the north. Even if Chu defeats Qin, it will not dare control Zhao.'

sentences.zh: 若楚不勝秦，必重趙。

translations.literal: If Chu does not defeat Qin, it will surely value Zhao.'

sentences.zh: 趙乘秦之獘，可以得志於天下。」

translations.literal: Zhao take advantage Qin fatigue, can achieve ambitions in world.'
translations.idiomatic: Zhao can take advantage of Qin's fatigue to achieve its ambitions in the world.'

sentences.zh: 趙王以為然，因不西兵，而遣故上谷卒史韓廣將兵北徇燕地。

translations.literal: The Zhao king thought this right, so he did not send troops west. Instead, he sent the former Shanggu adjutant Han Guang to lead troops north and sweep through Yan lands.

Wu Chen reached Handan and established himself as Zhao king, with Chen Yu as grand general and Zhang Er and Zhao Sao as left and right chancellors. The Chen king was angry, arrested Wu Chen and others' families, wanting to execute them. The Grand Marshal said: 'While Qin has not yet perished, executing the Zhao king's generals' and chancellors' families—this creates another Qin. Better to acknowledge and confirm their positions.' The Chen king then sent envoys to congratulate Zhao, moved Wu Chen and others' families into the palace, and enfeoffed Zhang Er's son Zhang Ao as Lord of Chengdu, urging the Zhao troops to quickly enter the pass. The Zhao king's generals and chancellors consulted together, saying: 'To king ourselves over Zhao was not Chu's intention. If Chu destroys Qin, they will surely turn their troops against Zhao. The best plan is not to send troops west, but to send envoys north to take Yan territory and expand ourselves. Zhao controls the Yellow River to the south and will have Yan and Dai to the north. Even if Chu defeats Qin, they won't dare control Zhao. If Chu doesn't defeat Qin, they will certainly value Zhao. Zhao can take advantage of Qin's exhaustion and achieve its ambitions under heaven.' The Zhao king agreed, so they didn't send troops west, but sent the former county clerk of Shanggu, Han Guang, to lead troops north to take Yan territory.

sentences.zh: 燕故貴人豪傑謂韓廣曰：「楚已立王，趙又已立王。

translations.literal: Yan former nobles outstanding men told Han Guang said: 'Chu already established king, Zhao also already established king.
translations.idiomatic: Yan's former nobles and outstanding men told Han Guang: 'Chu has already established a king, and Zhao has also already established a king.'

sentences.zh: 燕雖小，亦萬乘之國也，願將軍立為燕王。」

translations.literal: Yan though small, also ten thousand chariots country, wish general establish as Yan king.'
translations.idiomatic: Though Yan is small, it is still a country of ten thousand chariots. We wish the general to establish himself as Yan king.'

sentences.zh: 韓廣曰：「廣母在趙，不可。」

translations.literal: Han Guang said: 'Guang mother in Zhao, cannot.'
translations.idiomatic: Han Guang said: 'My mother is in Zhao. I cannot.'

sentences.zh: 燕人曰：「趙方西憂秦，南憂楚，其力不能禁我。

translations.literal: Yan people said: 'Zhao currently west worries Qin, south worries Chu, its strength cannot prohibit us.
translations.idiomatic: The Yan people said: 'Zhao is currently worried about Qin to the west and Chu to the south. Its strength cannot prohibit us.'

sentences.zh: 且以楚之彊，不敢害趙王將相之家，趙獨安敢害將軍之家！」

translations.literal: Moreover with Chu strength, not dare harm Zhao king generals chancellors families, Zhao alone how dare harm general family!'
translations.idiomatic: Moreover, with Chu's strength, it does not dare harm the Zhao king's generals and chancellors' families. How much less would Zhao dare harm the general's family!'

sentences.zh: 韓廣以為然，乃自立為燕王。

translations.literal: Han Guang thought this right and then established himself as Yan king.

sentences.zh: 居數月，趙奉燕王母及家屬歸之燕。

translations.literal: After several months, Zhao presented the Yan king's mother and family and returned them to Yan.

Yan's former nobles and leaders said to Han Guang: 'Chu has already established a king, Zhao has also established a king. Yan, though small, is also a state of ten thousand chariots. We wish for you, general, to establish yourself as Yan king.' Han Guang said: 'My mother is in Zhao, I cannot.' The Yan people said: 'Zhao is worried about Qin to the west and Chu to the south—their strength cannot stop us. Moreover, despite Chu's strength, they don't dare harm the Zhao king's generals' and chancellors' families, so how would Zhao dare harm your family!' Han Guang agreed and established himself as Yan king. After several months, Zhao escorted the Yan king's mother and family back to Yan.

sentences.zh: 當此之時，諸將之徇地者，不可勝數。

translations.literal: At this time, the various generals sweeping through lands were too numerous to count.

sentences.zh: 周市北徇地至狄，狄人田儋殺狄令，自立為齊王，以齊反擊周市。

translations.literal: Zhou Shi swept north through the lands and arrived at Di. The Di person Tian Dan killed the Di magistrate and established himself as Qi king. With Qi he counterattacked Zhou Shi.

sentences.zh: 市軍散，還至魏地，欲立魏後故甯陵君咎為魏王。

translations.literal: Shi's army scattered. He returned to Wei lands and wished to establish Jiu, the former Lord of Ningling and Wei descendant, as Wei king.

sentences.zh: 時咎在陳王所，不得之魏。

translations.literal: At the time, Jiu was at the Chen king's place and could not be obtained for Wei.

sentences.zh: 魏地已定，欲相與立周市為魏王，周市不肯。

translations.literal: The Wei lands were already pacified. They wished to mutually establish Zhou Shi as Wei king, but Zhou Shi was not willing.

sentences.zh: 使者五反，陳王乃立甯陵君咎為魏王，遣之國。

translations.literal: Envoys went back and forth five times. The Chen king then established Lord Jiu of Ningling as Wei king and sent him to the state.

sentences.zh: 周市卒為相。

translations.literal: Zhou Shi finally became chancellor.

At this time, the generals taking territory were too many to count. Zhou Shi went north taking territory to Di. The Di man Tian Dan killed the Di magistrate and established himself as Qi king, using Qi forces to counterattack Zhou Shi. Zhou Shi's army scattered and returned to Wei territory, wanting to establish the former Lord of Ningling, Jiu, as Wei king (the descendant of the Wei royal house). At the time, Jiu was with the Chen king and could not be brought to Wei. Wei territory was already pacified; they wanted to establish Zhou Shi as Wei king together, but Zhou Shi refused. Envoys went back and forth five times, then the Chen king established Lord Ningling Jiu as Wei king and sent him to his state. Zhou Shi eventually became chancellor.

sentences.zh: 將軍田臧等相與謀曰：「周章軍已破矣，秦兵旦暮至，我圍滎陽城弗能下，秦軍至，必大敗。

translations.literal: General Tian Zang etc. mutually plotted said: 'Zhou Zhang army already broken, Qin troops morning evening arrive, I besiege Xing Yang city not able conquer, Qin army arrives, must greatly defeated.
translations.idiomatic: General Tian Zang and others plotted together, saying: 'Zhou Zhang's army has already been broken. Qin troops will arrive any morning or evening. I besiege Xingyang city but cannot conquer it. When the Qin army arrives, I will surely be greatly defeated.'

sentences.zh: 不如少遺兵，足以守（熒）［滎］陽，悉精兵迎秦軍。

translations.literal: It would be better to leave a few troops, sufficient to guard Xingyang, and lead all the elite troops to meet the Qin army.'

sentences.zh: 今假王驕，不知兵權，不可與計，非誅之，事恐敗。」

translations.literal: Now acting king arrogant, not know military authority, cannot with plan, not execute him, matter fears fail.'
translations.idiomatic: Now the acting king is arrogant and does not know military authority. He cannot be planned with. If we do not execute him, the matter will surely fail.'

sentences.zh: 因相與矯王令以誅吳叔，獻其首於陳王。

translations.literal: They therefore mutually forged the king's command to execute Wu Shu and presented his head to the Chen king.

sentences.zh: 陳王使使賜田臧楚令尹印，使為上將。

translations.literal: The Chen king sent an envoy to give Tian Zang the Chu prime minister seal and made him supreme general.

sentences.zh: 田臧乃使諸將李歸等守滎陽城，自以精兵西迎秦軍於敖倉。

translations.literal: Tian Zang then had the various generals Li Gui and others guard Xingyang city, while he himself led elite troops west to meet the Qin army at Aocang.

sentences.zh: 與戰，田臧死，軍破。

translations.literal: They fought, Tian Zang died, and the army was broken.

sentences.zh: 章邯進兵擊李歸等滎陽下，破之，李歸等死。

translations.literal: Zhang Han advanced his troops and attacked Li Gui and others below Xingyang. He broke them, and Li Gui and others died.

The generals Tian Zang and others consulted together, saying: 'Zhou Wen's army has already been defeated; Qin troops will arrive any moment. We besiege Xingyang city but cannot capture it. When Qin troops arrive, we will surely be greatly defeated. Better to leave a small force sufficient to hold Xingyang, and send all our best troops to meet the Qin army. Now the acting king is arrogant and doesn't understand military strategy. We cannot consult with him. If we don't execute him, our cause will surely fail.' So they forged the king's orders to execute Wu Shu and presented his head to the Chen king. The Chen king sent envoys to bestow upon Tian Zang the seal of Chu's prime minister, making him supreme commander. Tian Zang then ordered the generals Li Gui and others to defend Xingyang city, while he himself led elite troops west to meet the Qin army at Ao Granary. They fought, Tian Zang died, and the army was defeated. Zhang Han advanced and attacked Li Gui and others beneath Xingyang, defeated them, and Li Gui and others died.

sentences.zh: 陽城人鄧說將兵居郯，章邯別將擊破之，鄧說軍散走陳。

translations.literal: Deng Yue of Yangcheng led troops and resided at Tan. Zhang Han's separate general attacked and broke them. Deng Yue's army scattered and fled to Chen.

sentences.zh: 铚人伍徐將兵居許，章邯擊破之，伍徐軍皆散走陳。

translations.literal: Wu Xu of Zhi led troops and resided at Xu. Zhang Han attacked and broke them. Wu Xu's army all scattered and fled to Chen.

sentences.zh: 陳王誅鄧說。

translations.literal: The Chen king executed Deng Yue.

Deng Shuo from Yangcheng, commanding troops stationed at Tan, was attacked by Zhang Han's lieutenant general, his army scattered and fled to Chen. Wu Xu from Zhi, commanding troops stationed at Xu, was attacked by Zhang Han, his army all scattered and fled to Chen. The Chen king executed Deng Shuo.

sentences.zh: 陳王初立時，陵人秦嘉、铚人董緶符離人朱雞石、取慮人鄭布、徐人丁疾等皆特起，將兵圍東海守慶於郯。

translations.literal: When the Chen king was first established, Qin Jia of Ling, Dong Chen of Zhi, Zhu Jishi of Fuli, Zheng Bu of Qulu, Ding Ji of Xu and others all rose up specially. They led troops and surrounded Governor Qing of Donghai at Tan.

sentences.zh: 陳王聞，乃使武平君畔為將軍，監郯下軍。

translations.literal: The Chen king heard and then made Lord Pan of Wuping a general to oversee the army below Tan.

sentences.zh: 秦嘉不受命，嘉自立為大司馬，惡屬武平君。

translations.literal: Qin Jia did not accept the command. Jia established himself as grand marshal and hated being subordinate to Lord Wuping.

sentences.zh: 告軍吏曰：「武平君年少，不知兵事，勿聽！」

translations.literal: Told army officials said: 'Wu Ping lord young, not know military matters, do not listen!'
translations.idiomatic: He told the army officials: 'Lord Wuping is young and does not know military matters. Do not listen to him!'

sentences.zh: 因矯以王命殺武平君畔。

translations.literal: Therefore, he forged the king's command and killed Lord Pan of Wuping.

When the Chen king was first established, Qin Jia from Ling, Dong Shen from Zhi, Zhu Jishi from Fuli, Zheng Bu from Qulu, Ding Ji from Xu and others all rose up independently, leading troops to besiege Donghai governor Qing at Tan. The Chen king heard of this and sent Lord Wuping Pan as general to supervise the army besieging Tan. Qin Jia did not accept the orders, establishing himself as Grand Commander, refusing to subordinate himself to Lord Wuping. He told the army officers: 'Lord Wuping is young and doesn't understand military affairs—don't listen to him!' So he forged the king's orders to kill Lord Wuping Pan.

sentences.zh: 章邯已破伍徐，擊陳，柱國房君死。

translations.literal: Zhang Han had already broken Wu Xu and attacked Chen. The Pillar State Lord Fang died.

sentences.zh: 章邯又進兵擊陳西張賀軍。

translations.literal: Zhang Han again advanced his troops and attacked Zhang He's army west of Chen.

sentences.zh: 陳王出監戰，軍破，張賀死。

translations.literal: The Chen king went out to oversee the battle. The army was broken, and Zhang He died.

Zhang Han had already defeated Wu Xu and attacked Chen; the Grand Marshal Lord Fang died. Zhang Han again advanced to attack Zhang He's army west of Chen. The Chen king went out to oversee the battle; the army was defeated and Zhang He died.

sentences.zh: 臘月，陳王之汝陰，還至下城父，其御莊賈殺以降秦。

translations.literal: In the twelfth month, the Chen king went to Ruyin. On his return to Xiachengfu, his charioteer Zhuang Jia killed him and surrendered to Qin.

sentences.zh: 陳勝葬碭，謚曰隱王。

translations.literal: Chen Sheng was buried at Dang with the posthumous name of Hidden King.

In the twelfth month, the Chen king went to Ruyin, and on his return to Xiachengfu, his charioteer Zhuang Jia killed him and surrendered to Qin. Chen Sheng was buried at Dang with the posthumous title of Hidden King.

sentences.zh: 陳王故涓人將軍呂臣為倉頭軍，起新陽，攻陳下之，殺莊賈，復以陳為楚。

translations.literal: The Chen king's former attendant General Lu Chen organized a granary head army. He rose at Xinyang, attacked Chen and took it, killed Zhuang Jia, and again made Chen into Chu.
The Chen king's former attendant general Lü Chen raised an army of slaves, starting from Xinyang, attacked Chen and captured it, killed Zhuang Jia, and restored Chen as Chu.

sentences.zh: 初，陳王至陳，令铚人宋留將兵定南陽，入武關。

translations.literal: Initially, when the Chen king arrived at Chen, he ordered Song Liu of Zhi to lead troops to pacify Nanyang and enter Wuguan.

sentences.zh: 留已徇南陽，聞陳王死，南陽復為秦。

translations.literal: Liu had already swept through Nanyang. When he heard the Chen king had died, Nanyang again became Qin.

sentences.zh: 宋留不能入武關，乃東至新蔡，遇秦軍，宋留以軍降秦。

translations.literal: Song Liu could not enter Wuguan. He then went east to Xincai, encountered Qin troops, and Song Liu surrendered his army to Qin.

sentences.zh: 秦傳留至咸陽，車裂留以徇。

translations.literal: Qin transported Liu to Xianyang and executed him by cart tearing as an example.

Initially, when the Chen king reached Chen, he ordered Song Liu from Zhi to lead troops to pacify Nanyang and enter Wuguan Pass. Song Liu had already taken Nanyang, but when he heard the Chen king was dead, Nanyang reverted to Qin. Song Liu could not enter Wuguan Pass, so he went east to Xincai, encountered Qin troops, and Song Liu surrendered his army to Qin. Qin transported Song Liu to Xianyang and executed him by tearing apart his chariot as a warning.

sentences.zh: 秦嘉等聞陳王軍破出走，乃立景駒為楚王，引兵之方與，欲擊秦軍定陶下。

translations.literal: Qin Jia and others heard that the Chen king's army was broken and he had fled. They then established Jing Ju as Chu king, led troops to Fangyu, and wished to attack the Qin army below Dingtao.

sentences.zh: 使公孫慶使齊王，欲與并力俱進。

translations.literal: They sent Gongsun Qing as envoy to the Qi king, wishing to combine forces and advance together.

sentences.zh: 齊王曰：「聞陳王戰敗，不知其死生，楚安得不請而立王！」

translations.literal: Qi king said: 'Heard Chen king battle defeated, not know his life death, Chu how not ask established king!'
translations.idiomatic: The Qi king said: 'I heard the Chen king was defeated in battle and do not know if he is alive or dead. How can Chu not ask and establish a king!'

sentences.zh: 公孫慶曰：「齊不請楚而立王，楚何故請齊而立王！

translations.literal: Gong Sun Qing said: 'Qi not ask Chu established king, Chu why ask Qi established king!
translations.idiomatic: Gongsun Qing said: 'Qi did not ask Chu and established a king. Why should Chu ask Qi to establish a king!'

sentences.zh: 且楚首事，當令於天下。」

translations.literal: Moreover Chu first matter, should command world.'
translations.idiomatic: Moreover, Chu started the matter and should command the world.'

sentences.zh: 田儋誅殺公孫慶。

translations.literal: Tian Dan executed Gongsun Qing.

When Qin Jia and others heard that the Chen king's army was defeated and fleeing, they established Jing Ju as Chu king, led troops to Fangyu, wanting to attack the Qin army at Dingtao. They sent Gongsun Qing as envoy to the Qi king, wanting to combine forces and advance together. The Qi king said: 'I heard the Chen king was defeated, but I don't know if he's dead or alive. How can Chu establish a king without consulting me!' Gongsun Qing said: 'Qi didn't consult Chu when establishing its king, so why should Chu consult Qi when establishing its king! Moreover, Chu started this affair and should command the world.' Tian Dan executed Gongsun Qing.

sentences.zh: 秦左右校復攻陳，下之。

translations.literal: Qin's left and right commanders again attacked Chen and took it.

sentences.zh: 呂將軍走，收兵復聚。

translations.literal: General Lu fled but gathered troops and assembled again.

sentences.zh: 鄱盜當陽君黥布之兵相收，復擊秦左右校，破之青波，復以陳為楚。

translations.literal: The Po robbers and Lord Dangyang Ying Bu's troops gathered together. They again attacked Qin's left and right commanders, broke them at Qingbo, and again made Chen into Chu.

sentences.zh: 會項梁立懷王孫心為楚王。

translations.literal: At this time, Xiang Liang established the Huai king's grandson Xin as Chu king.

Qin's left and right guard units again attacked Chen and captured it. General Lü fled but gathered troops again. The Poyang bandits and Lord Dangyang Xiang Yu's troops joined together, again attacked Qin's left and right guard units, defeated them at Qingbo, and restored Chen as Chu. Just then, Xiang Liang established King Huai's grandson Xin as Chu king.

sentences.zh: 陳勝王凡六月。

translations.literal: Chen Sheng was king for altogether six months.

sentences.zh: 已為王，王陳。

translations.literal: He had already become king and made Chen his capital.

sentences.zh: 其故人嘗與庸耕者聞之，之陳，扣宮門曰：「吾欲見涉。」

translations.literal: His old friend once with hired plow heard it, went Chen, knocked palace gate said: 'I wish see She.'
translations.idiomatic: His old friend who had once hired himself out to plow with him heard of it. He went to Chen and knocked on the palace gate, saying: 'I wish to see She.'

sentences.zh: 宮門令欲縛之。

translations.literal: The palace gate official wished to bind him.

sentences.zh: 自辯數，乃置，不肯為通。

translations.literal: He argued with himself several times. He was then released but not announced.

sentences.zh: 陳王出，遮道而呼涉。

translations.literal: The Chen king went out and blocked the road, calling for She.

sentences.zh: 陳王聞之，乃召見，載與俱歸。

translations.literal: The Chen king heard of it and then summoned him for an audience. He carried him and returned together.

sentences.zh: 入宮，見殿屋帷帳，客曰：「夥頤！

translations.literal: Entered palace, saw hall rooms curtains tents, guest said: 'Plenty!
translations.idiomatic: He entered the palace and saw the hall rooms, curtains, and tents. The guest said: 'Plenty!'

sentences.zh: 涉之為王沈沈者！」

translations.literal: She as king deep ones!'
translations.idiomatic: She as king - so deep!'

sentences.zh: 楚人謂多為夥，故天下傳之，夥涉為王，由陳涉始。

translations.literal: Chu people call much 'plenty,' so the world transmitted it. 'Plenty She became king' began from Chen She.

sentences.zh: 客出入愈益發舒，言陳王故情。

translations.literal: The guest, entering and exiting, became increasingly relaxed and open, speaking of the Chen king's old feelings.

sentences.zh: 或說陳王曰：「客愚無知，顓妄言，輕威。」

translations.literal: Someone advised Chen king said: 'Guest foolish ignorant, one-sided wild words, lightens majesty.'
translations.idiomatic: Someone advised the Chen king: 'The guest is foolish and ignorant. He speaks one-sided wild words and lightens your majesty.'

sentences.zh: 陳王斬之。

translations.literal: The Chen king beheaded him.

sentences.zh: 諸陳王故人皆自引去，由是無親陳王者。

translations.literal: All the Chen king's old friends withdrew themselves. From this, there were no more intimates of the Chen king.

sentences.zh: 陳王以朱房為中正，胡武為司過，主司群臣。

translations.literal: The Chen king made Zhu Fang central upright and Hu Wu overseer of faults, mainly to oversee the ministers.

sentences.zh: 諸將徇地，至，令之不是者，系而罪之，以苛察為忠。

translations.literal: The various generals swept through lands. When they arrived, they bound and punished those who did not follow orders correctly, taking harsh scrutiny as loyalty.

sentences.zh: 其所不善者，弗下吏，輒自治之。

translations.literal: Those he disliked he did not send to officials but promptly handled himself.

sentences.zh: 陳王信用之。

translations.literal: The Chen king trusted and used them.

sentences.zh: 諸將以其故不親附，此其所以敗也。

translations.literal: The various generals because of this reason were not intimately attached. This was the reason he was defeated.

Chen Sheng reigned as king for six months in total. He had already become king, ruling over Chen. His old friend who had once worked as a hired laborer with him heard this and went to Chen, knocking on the palace gate saying: 'I want to see She.' The palace gate guard wanted to bind him. He explained himself repeatedly, so they let him go but refused to announce him. The Chen king came out and blocked the road calling for She. The Chen king heard this and summoned him for an audience, riding back to the palace together with him. Entering the palace and seeing the hall, curtains, and canopies, the guest said: 'Wow! She has become king in grand style!' Chu people call much 'huo', so the saying spread throughout the world: 'huo She became king', starting from Chen She. The guest came and went more freely, speaking of the Chen king's old feelings. Someone advised the Chen king: 'This guest is foolish and ignorant, monopolizes conversations, and treats your majesty lightly.' The Chen king executed him. All the Chen king's old friends then withdrew of their own accord; from this point on, no one was close to the Chen king. The Chen king made Zhu Fang the Chief Justice and Hu Wu the Supervisor of Officials, to oversee all the ministers. When generals took territory and arrived, if their orders weren't followed, he bound and punished them, considering harsh scrutiny as loyalty. Those he disliked, he didn't hand over to officials but personally handled their punishment. The Chen king trusted them. Because of this, the generals were not close to him—this was why he failed.

sentences.zh: 陳勝雖已死，其所置遣侯王將相竟亡秦，由涉首事也。

translations.literal: Though Chen Sheng was already dead, the marquises, kings, generals, and chancellors he established finally destroyed Qin. It was She who started the matter.'

sentences.zh: 高祖時為陳涉置守冢三十家碭，至今血食。

translations.literal: During Gao Zu's time, thirty households were established as tomb guards for Chen She at Dang. They receive sacrifices to this day.'

Although Chen Sheng was already dead, the marquises, kings, generals, and chancellors he appointed and sent ultimately destroyed Qin, because She started the affair. During the reign of Gaozu, thirty families were established at Dang to guard Chen She's tomb, and they still receive sacrifices today.

sentences.zh: 褚先生曰：地形險阻，所以為固也；

translations.literal: Chu mister said: 'Terrain dangerous obstructed, reason for solid;
translations.idiomatic: Master Chu said: 'Dangerous and obstructed terrain is what makes a place secure.'

sentences.zh: 兵革刑法，所以為治也。

translations.literal: Arms, armor, punishments, and laws are what make governance.'

sentences.zh: 猶未足恃也。

translations.literal: Yet these are still not sufficient to rely on.'

sentences.zh: 夫先王以仁義為本，而以固塞文法為枝葉，豈不然哉！

translations.literal: Indeed former kings with benevolence righteousness as root, and with solid barriers written laws as branches leaves, how not so!
translations.idiomatic: Indeed, the former kings took benevolence and righteousness as their root, and solid barriers and written laws as branches and leaves. Is this not so!'

sentences.zh: 吾聞賈生之稱曰：

translations.literal: I heard Jia Sheng's words said:
translations.idiomatic: I have heard Jia Sheng's words:'

translations.literal: Master Chu said: 'Difficult terrain and dangerous passes make a state secure; arms and armor, punishments and laws make a state orderly. Yet these are not enough to rely on. The former kings took benevolence and righteousness as their foundation, and fortifications and laws as branches and leaves—was this not so!' I have heard Jia Sheng say:

sentences.zh: 秦孝公據殽函之固，擁雍州之地，君臣固守，以窺周室。

translations.literal: Qin Xiao Gong occupied Xiao Han's solid, embraced Yong Zhou's lands, ruler ministers firmly guarded, to spy Zhou chambers.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Xiao of Qin occupied the solid defenses of Xiaohan, embraced Yongzhou's lands, and ruler and ministers firmly guarded them, spying on the Zhou court.'

sentences.zh: 有席卷天下，包舉宇內，囊括四海之意，并吞八荒之心。

translations.literal: He had the intention to roll up the world, package up the universe, embrace the four seas, and swallow the eight wastes.'

sentences.zh: 當是時也，商君佐之，內立法度，務耕織，修守戰之備；

translations.literal: At this time, Shang lord assisted him, internally established laws measures, devoted farming weaving, repaired defense battle preparations;
translations.idiomatic: At this time, Lord Shang assisted him. Internally he established laws and measures, devoted himself to farming and weaving, and repaired preparations for defense and battle.'

sentences.zh: 外連衡而鬬諸侯。

translations.literal: Externally he connected horizontally and fought the feudal lords.'

sentences.zh: 於是秦人拱手而取西河之外。

translations.literal: Thus Qin people effortlessly took the lands west of the Xi River.'

Duke Xiao of Qin occupied the secure passes of Xiao and Han, possessed Yong province, and lord and ministers held firm to spy on the Zhou court. He had the intention to sweep up all under heaven, encompass the world, gather the four seas, and swallow the eight wastes. At that time, Lord Shang assisted him, establishing laws and measures internally, emphasizing farming and weaving, preparing for defense and war; externally using alliances to fight the feudal lords. Thus Qin easily took the land west of the Yellow River.

sentences.zh: 孝公既沒，惠文王、武王、昭王蒙故業，因遺策，南取漢中，西舉巴蜀，東割膏腴之地，收要害之郡。

translations.literal: After Duke Xiao died, Kings Huiwen, Wu, and Zhao inherited his enterprise and followed his remaining plans. They took Hanzhong to the south, raised Bashu to the west, cut fertile lands to the east, and gathered strategic commanderies.'

sentences.zh: 諸侯恐懼，會盟而謀弱秦。

translations.literal: The feudal lords feared and assembled in alliance to plot weakening Qin.'

sentences.zh: 不愛珍器重寶肥饒之地，以致天下之士。

translations.literal: They did not love precious vessels, heavy treasures, or fertile abundant lands, but used them to attract the world's scholars.'

sentences.zh: 合從締交，相與為一。

translations.literal: They combined vertically, concluded friendships, and mutually became one.'

sentences.zh: 當此之時，齊有孟嘗，趙有平原，楚有春申，魏有信陵：此四君者，皆明知而忠信，寬厚而愛人，尊賢而重士。

translations.literal: At this time, Qi had Meng Chang, Zhao had Ping Yuan, Chu had Chun Shen, Wei had Xin Ling: these four lords, all clear knowing loyal trustworthy, broad thick loved people, honored worthy valued scholars.
translations.idiomatic: At this time, Qi had Lord Mengchang, Zhao had Lord Pingyuan, Chu had Lord Chunshen, Wei had Lord Xinling. These four lords were all clear-sighted and trustworthy, broad-minded and loving toward people, honored the worthy and valued scholars.'

sentences.zh: 約從連衡，兼韓、魏、燕、趙、宋、衛、中山之眾。

translations.literal: They covenanted vertically and connected horizontally, combining the multitudes of Han, Wei, Yan, Zhao, Song, Wei, and Zhongshan.'

sentences.zh: 於是六國之士有甯越、徐尚、蘇秦、杜赫之屬為之謀，齊明、周聚、陳軫、邵滑、樓緩、翟景、蘇厲、樂毅之徒通其意，吳起、孫臏、帶他、兒良、王廖、田忌、廉頗、趙奢之倫制其兵。

translations.literal: Thus the six states' scholars had Ning Yue, Xu Shang, Su Qin, and Du He and their kind to plan for them. Qi Ming, Zhou Ju, Chen Zhen, Shao Hua, Lou Huan, Di Jing, Su Li, and Yue Yi and their followers communicated their intentions. Wu Qi, Sun Bin, Dai Ta, Er Liang, Wang Liao, Tian Ji, Lian Po, and Zhao She and their sort controlled their troops.'

sentences.zh: 嘗以什倍之地，百萬之師，仰關而攻秦。

translations.literal: Once with ten times the lands and a million troops, they looked up at the pass and attacked Qin.'

sentences.zh: 秦人開關而延敵，九國之師遁逃而不敢進。

translations.literal: The Qin people opened the pass and invited the enemy. The nine states' troops fled and dared not advance.'

sentences.zh: 秦無亡矢遺鏃之費，而天下固已困矣。

translations.literal: Qin expended not even a lost arrow or remaining arrowhead, yet the world was already distressed.'

sentences.zh: 於是從散約敗，爭割地而賂秦。

translations.literal: Thus the vertical alliance scattered and the covenant was defeated. They contended to cut lands and bribe Qin.'

sentences.zh: 秦有餘力而制其獘，追亡逐北，伏尸百萬，流血漂櫓，因利乘便，宰割天下，分裂山河，彊國請服，弱國入朝。

translations.literal: Qin had surplus strength and controlled their fatigue. They pursued the fleeing and chased to the north. A million corpses lay prostrate, blood flowed to float oars. Taking advantage and multiplying convenience, they butchered the world, split mountains and rivers. Strong states requested submission, weak states entered court.'

After Duke Xiao died, Kings Huiwen, Wu, and Zhao inherited the legacy, following the old strategy: south they took Hanzhong, west they took Bashu, east they divided the fertile lands and collected the strategic commanderies. The feudal lords were terrified, gathered in alliance and plotted to weaken Qin. They spared no precious vessels, heavy treasures, or fertile lands to attract the world's scholars. They formed vertical alliances and made pacts, uniting as one. At this time, Qi had Lord Mengchang, Zhao had Lord Pingyuan, Chu had Lord Chunshen, Wei had Lord Xinling: these four lords were all wise and trustworthy, broad-minded and loving, honoring the worthy and respecting scholars. They formed vertical alliances and horizontal connections, combining the forces of Han, Wei, Yan, Zhao, Song, Wei, and Zhongshan. Thus the scholars of the six states had Ning Yue, Xu Shang, Su Qin, Du He and others to plan for them, Qi Ming, Zhou Ju, Chen Zhen, Shao Hua, Lou Huan, Di Jing, Su Li, Yue Yi and others to convey their intentions, Wu Qi, Sun Bin, Dai Ta, Er Liang, Wang Liao, Tian Ji, Lian Po, Zhao She and others to command their armies. They once used ten times the territory and million-man armies, looking up at the pass to attack Qin. Qin opened the pass and invited the enemy, the armies of the nine states fled and dared not advance. Qin spent not an arrow or arrowhead, yet the world was already exhausted. Thus the alliances scattered and pacts failed, they competed to divide land and bribe Qin. Qin had surplus strength to exploit their exhaustion, pursued the fleeing and chased the routed, leaving a million corpses, blood flowing to float oars, taking advantage of opportunities, carving up the world, splitting mountains and rivers, strong states seeking submission, weak states coming to court.

sentences.zh: 施及孝文王、莊襄王，享國之日淺，國家無事。

translations.literal: This extended to Kings Xiaowen and Zhuangxiang. The days they enjoyed ruling were few, and the state had no matters.'

sentences.zh: 及至始皇，奮六世之餘烈，振長策而御宇內，吞二周而亡諸侯，履至尊而制六合，執敲樸以鞭笞天下，威振四海。

translations.literal: When it reached the First Emperor, he exerted the remaining brilliance of six generations, shook the long whip and drove the universe, swallowed the two Zhous and perished the feudal lords, trod the utmost honor and controlled the six directions, grasped the knocker club to whip and lash the world, his might shaking the four seas.'

sentences.zh: 南取百越之地，以為桂林、象郡，百越之君俛首系頸，委命下吏。

translations.literal: He took the Baiyue lands to the south and made them Guilin and Xiang commandery. The Baiyue lords bowed their heads and tied their necks, entrusting their lives to lower officials.'

sentences.zh: 乃使蒙恬北筑長城而守藩籬，卻匈奴七百餘里，胡人不敢南下而牧馬，士亦不敢貫弓而報怨。

translations.literal: He then had Meng Tian build the long wall to the north as a guarding fence, repelling the Xiongnu over seven hundred li. The Hu people dared not come south to pasture their horses, and scholars dared not draw their bows to report grievances.'

sentences.zh: 於是廢先王之道，燔百家之言，以愚黔首。

translations.literal: Thus he abolished the former kings' way and burned the hundred schools' words to fool the black-headed people.'

sentences.zh: 墮名城，殺豪俊，收天下之兵聚之咸陽，銷鋒鍉，鑄以為金人十二，以弱天下之民。

translations.literal: He destroyed famous cities, killed outstanding men, gathered the world's weapons and assembled them at Xianyang, melted the sharp points, and cast them as twelve gold men to weaken the world's people.'

sentences.zh: 然後踐華為城，因河為池，據億丈之城，臨不測之谿以為固。

translations.literal: Then he trod on splendor as his city, took the river as his moat, occupied the hundred million zhang city, and faced the unfathomable gorge for security.'

sentences.zh: 良將勁弩，守要害之處，信臣精卒，陳利兵而誰何。

translations.literal: Good generals and strong crossbows guarded strategic places. Trustworthy ministers and elite troops displayed sharp weapons and challenged intruders.'

sentences.zh: 天下已定，始皇之心，自以為關中之固，金城千里，子孫帝王萬世之業也。

translations.literal: The world was already pacified. In the First Emperor's heart, he thought Guanzhong's defenses solid, a gold city of a thousand li, an enterprise for descendants to be emperor and king for ten thousand generations.'

This continued to Kings Xiaowen and Zhuangxiang, who reigned for short periods with no national affairs. When it came to the First Emperor, he wielded the remaining glory of six generations, brandished the long whip to control the world, swallowed the two Zhou and destroyed the feudal lords, ascended the supreme position and controlled the six directions, held the knotted cane to lash the world, his might shaking the four seas. South he took the land of Baiyue, making Guilin and Xiang commanderies, the Baiyue lords bowed their heads and bound their necks, entrusting their fate to lowly officials. He had Meng Tian build the Great Wall north to guard the frontier, repelling the Xiongnu seven hundred li, the barbarians dared not come south to graze their horses, soldiers dared not draw their bows to avenge grievances. Thus he discarded the former kings' way, burned the hundred schools' writings, to make the common people foolish. He demolished famous cities, killed outstanding men, gathered the world's weapons in Xianyang, melted the sharp blades and cast twelve golden statues, to weaken the world's people. Then he trampled Mount Hua as his city wall, used the river as his moat, occupied the hundred-thousand-zhang city, overlooking the unfathomable gorge for security. Good generals and strong crossbows guarded strategic places, trusted ministers and elite troops displayed sharp weapons and challenged intruders. The world now pacified, the First Emperor's heart considered Guanzhong's security a golden city of a thousand li, an imperial enterprise for his descendants for ten thousand generations.

sentences.zh: 始皇既沒，餘威振於殊俗。

translations.literal: The First Emperor had already died, yet his remaining might shook different customs.'

sentences.zh: 然而陳涉甕牖繩樞之子，甿隸之人，而遷徙之徒也。

translations.literal: However, Chen She was the son of an urn-window rope-pivot family, a rural servant person, and a migrant.'

sentences.zh: 材能不及中人，非有仲尼、墨翟之賢，陶朱、猗頓之富也。

translations.literal: His talent and ability did not reach the average person. He did not have Confucius or Mozi's wisdom, or Tao Zhu or Yidun's wealth.'

sentences.zh: 躡足行伍之閒，俛仰仟佰之中，率罷散之卒，將數百之眾，轉而攻秦。

translations.literal: He stepped among the ranks and files, bent and raised among the thousand and hundred, led exhausted scattered troops, commanded a multitude of several hundred, and turned to attack Qin.'

sentences.zh: 斬木為兵，揭竿為旗，天下雲會響應，贏糧而景從，山東豪俊遂并起而亡秦族矣。

translations.literal: He cut wood for weapons, raised poles for banners. The world gathered like clouds and echoed in response. They carried grain and followed like shadows. The Shandong outstanding men then rose together and destroyed the Qin clan.'

After the First Emperor died, his remaining might shook distant lands. Yet Chen She was the son of a thatched-window, rope-hinge house, a peasant serf, a conscripted laborer. His talent and ability were below average, he did not have Confucius or Mozi's wisdom, Tao Zhu or Yi Dun's wealth. Treading among the ranks of soldiers, bending and bowing among the officers, leading exhausted scattered troops, commanding a few hundred men, he turned and attacked Qin. Cutting wood for weapons, raising poles as flags, the world gathered like clouds in response, carrying grain and following his shadow, the Shandong heroes all rose together and destroyed the Qin clan.

sentences.zh: 且天下非小弱也；

translations.literal: Moreover world not small weak;
translations.idiomatic: Moreover, the world was not small and weak.'

sentences.zh: 雍州之地，殽函之固自若也。

translations.literal: Yongzhou's lands and Xiaohan's defenses were as before.'

sentences.zh: 陳涉之位，非尊於齊、楚、燕、趙、韓、魏、宋、衛、中山之君也；

translations.literal: Chen She position, not noble than Qi, Chu, Yan, Zhao, Han, Wei, Song, Wei, Zhong Shan lords;
translations.idiomatic: Chen She's position was not more noble than the lords of Qi, Chu, Yan, Zhao, Han, Wei, Song, Wei, and Zhongshan.'

sentences.zh: 鉏耰棘矜，非铦於句戟長鎩也；

translations.literal: Plow rake thorn shaft, not sharp than hooked halberd long spear;
translations.idiomatic: His plow, rake, thorn shaft were not sharper than hooked halberds and long spears.'

sentences.zh: 適戍之眾，非儔於九國之師也；

translations.literal: Going garrison multitude, not equal nine states troops;
translations.idiomatic: His multitude going to garrison was not equal to the nine states' troops.'

sentences.zh: 深謀遠慮，行軍用兵之道，非及鄉時之士也。

translations.literal: His deep plans and far considerations, the way of marching and using troops, did not reach the scholars of former times.'

sentences.zh: 然而成敗異變，功業相反也。

translations.literal: However, success and failure have different changes. Merit and enterprise are opposite.'

sentences.zh: 嘗試使山東之國與陳涉度長絜大，比權量力，則不可同年而語矣。

translations.literal: Try to make the Shandong states measure length and compare greatness with Chen She, compare authority and measure strength, and they cannot be spoken of in the same year.'

sentences.zh: 然而秦以區區之地。

translations.literal: However, Qin with its small lands,'

sentences.zh: 致萬乘之權，抑八州而朝同列，百有餘年矣。

translations.literal: achieved the authority of ten thousand chariots, suppressed the eight provinces and made the same rank come to court, for over a hundred years.'

sentences.zh: 然後以六合為家，殽函為宮。

translations.literal: Then took the six directions as home and Xiaohan as palace.'

sentences.zh: 一夫作難而七廟墮，身死人手，為天下笑者，何也？

translations.literal: One man made difficulty seven temples fell, body died people hands, became world laughter, what?
translations.idiomatic: One man made difficulty and seven ancestral temples fell. His body died in people's hands and became the world's laughter. Why?'

sentences.zh: 仁義不施，而攻守之勢異也。

translations.literal: Benevolence and righteousness were not applied, but the situation of attack and defense was different.'

Moreover, the world was not small and weak; Yong province's land, Xiao and Han's fortifications remained as before. Chen She's position was not more honored than the lords of Qi, Chu, Yan, Zhao, Han, Wei, Song, Wei, and Zhongshan; hoe handles and thorn spears were not sharper than hooked halberds and long lances; the conscripted crowds were not equal to the nine states' armies; deep plans and far-reaching considerations, the way of marching and using troops, were not equal to the scholars of former times. Yet success and failure changed, achievements were opposite. If one were to have the Shandong states compare length and measure size with Chen She, weigh authority and measure strength, they could not be mentioned in the same year. Yet Qin with a mere small territory. achieved the authority of ten thousand chariots, suppressed the eight provinces and made peers come to court, for more than a hundred years. Then took the six directions as home, Xiao and Han as palace. One man rose in rebellion and the seven ancestral temples fell, his body died by human hands, becoming a laughingstock for the world—what was the reason? Benevolence and righteousness were not practiced, while the situation of attack and defense was different.
